pageContext.desc: Notifying daughter of his expedition to the Mountains.
pageContext.category: Everett D. Graff Collection of Western Americana; U.S. Western Expansion; Letters (Correspondence)

pages.transcription:
Sioux City
Steamer Robert Campbell June 9th 56
My Dear Daughter
From my last you would infer that I had intended to return but circumstances since that has changed my course we are now on our way to the Mountains - on the arrival at St Lo? of the Steamer Robert Campbell for I met on her Col Vaughan with numerous friends who were anxious that I should accompany the Exploration? that with the Capt offering

us a free passige to Fort Benton you must not be with Fany be disappointed but bear up - and endeavour to pass usefully once as pleasantly as circumstances will permit untill I return which will be in the fall when I shall pass through Palmira - in the mean spare no pains to ? to facilitate the Education of give every good advice to study - at the same time I want you to be careful of her health as you know she is not over strong

Keep up a corrispondance with Jane and let her know the contents of my Letter - your Mother says tell Jane she must keep that Little Girl go constanly to School
you will hear from me frequently before I reach Fort Benton
Give our kind Regards to Uncle & Aunt
Yourself & Fany
accept our Affection
Your Affectionate
Father
Alex Culbertson

pageContext.title: Alexander Culbertson letter to Julia Culbertson Roberts, 1856
